page.title: 12Hatfield Broad Oak Farms: 1
page.content: { Information derived from an { interview with a local farmer. The local farms of today represent amalgamations of several smaller farms of earlier times. For instance, the farm now run by one family consortium comprises land formerly part of four separate farms: Anthonys, Benningtons, Waters and Rolls (the last comprising a few fields at Hatfield Heath). This means that the fields are not all grouped together but are somewhat scattered. They are partly owned and partly rented. The main crop is wheat, for which this part of Essex is well-known, but barley, rape, peas, beans and sugar beet are also grown, the last three forming useful 'break' crops in a rotation cycle. In addition, the farm has a small herd of meat cattle and some sheep.
